original_title: FLOSS Weekly Episode 766: WebRTC — The Hack that Connects Everyone to Everything
original_content:
This week Jonathan Bennett and Dan Lynch talk with Sean DuBois, WebRTC wizard, all about the crazy feats the Pion Go server is capable of, how WebRTC is about to change OBS, and what it looks like to build a successful Open Source Career.
WebRTC is for more than video. The TOR Snowflake project uses Pion to sneak TOR traffic through firewalls even with Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) at play. Since nobody wants to block web conferencing, TOR and even Wireguard can use this to slip though.
Sean is also working on some game-changing patches for OBS Studio, including WHEP support to go along with the newly introduced WHIP feature. This enables direct connections to another OBS client, as well as connection to another WebRTC client like vdo.ninja without running an embedded browser to make it work.
And then theres WebRTC For The Curious, a free CC0 e-book all about the nuts and bolts of WebRTC. And Broadcast Box, a ready-to-run WebRTC one-to-many broadcasting solution that lets you run your own streaming service. You can connect with Sean at the Real-time Broadcast Discord server for information about all of the projects listed here and more!

Did you know you can watch the live recording of the show right in the Hackaday Discord? Next week were interviewing Jan-Piet Mens of the OwnTracks project!

Direct Download in DRM-free MP3.
For fans of the written word, weve got the transcript for this weeks episode right here.

title: 「Pion Goサーバーの驚くべき能力とWebRTCのOBSへの影響」
body: 今週の話題は、Pion Goサーバーの能力、WebRTCがOBSをどのように変えるか、成功するオープンソースのキャリアということです。また、Pionを使用してTORトラフィックをファイアウォールを通過させる方法についても話しました。そして、OBS Studio向けのゲームチェンジングなパッチ、WebRTCに関する無料のe-bookやブロードキャストボックスなど、他のプロジェクトについても触れました。
titles: 「Pion Goサーバーの驚くべき能力とWebRTCのOBSへの影響」
「TORプロジェクトとPionの組み合わせでWebRTCがファイアウォールを突破」
「OBS Studioのゲーム変革的なパッチと新機能の紹介」
「WebRTCの基本を学ぶための無料e-book『WebRTC For The Curious』」
「自分のストリーミングサービスを運営できるWebRTCのライブ配信ソリューション」
